channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why there's an unexpected surge in people claiming Social Security
item.description: Some early filers say worries about the future under the Trump administration moved up their timelines.

item.title: Supreme Court says family can sue over wrong-house raid
item.description: A unanimous Supreme Court said a family whose house was wrongly raided by law enforcement can sue.

item.title: Snapchat adds new features for creators, including an easier way to edit videos
item.description: Snapchat is introducing a suite of new tools and features to make it easier for creators to post and share content on its platform.

item.title: Harvard researcher charged with smuggling frog embryos is released from federal custody on bail
Here are Apple’s top AI announcements from WWDC 2025
item.description: At WWDC 2025, Apple announced several AI features, such as a workout coach, live translation, and more.

item.title: Chime almost died in 2016, turned down by 100 VCs — today it IPO’d at $14.5B
item.description: In 2016 when Chime desperately needed cash, over 100 VCs said no. One seed VC took a chance and saved the company, co-founder Ryan King recalls.

item.title: a16z-backed Infinite Machine shows off cheaper, modular electric scooter
item.description: The Olto is the newest entry into the always-churning market for electric two-wheelers, and it will cost $3,495.

item.title: Supreme Court revives lawsuit from Atlanta family whose home was wrongly raided by the FBI

item.description: President Donald Trump’s use of troops to help carry out intensified immigration raids faces its biggest challenge yet on Thursday.
